website_summaries.verdict: Easy-to-use binoculars that aren't affected by rain or low-light conditions.
pros: Easy to adjust to fit your eyes and to focus
cons: Not ideal if you're looking for a product with a long range

website_summaries.verdict: Compact and fairly durable at their price point, new users may have trouble setting up these binoculars.
pros: Very light and compact, fitting easily in one hand
Can handle bumps, jolts, and drops from waist height
Textured surface makes binoculars easy to hold in wet conditions
cons: Some drag in the focus wheel when adjusting
Instructions are confusing and difficult for new users

customer_reviews.title: Great little binocular, although the strap needs special handling.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the binoculars to use when visiting Yellowstone for a week, and they worked great. The small, lightweight size did not diminish their functionality. The one problem is the neck strap that comes with them: it kept slipping off, and the binoculars could have been ruined by a hard fall, or lost into a canyon or hot spring. But this is easily fixed, which is why I went ahead and rated it a 5. One just needs to run the end of the strap through part of the buckle a third time.
customer_reviews.author: DR Brown

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for an 11 year old!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 11 year old daughter who had trouble using my Bushnell binoculars. These are the perfect size for her eyes; are lightweight, easy to hold and provide excellent distance magnification & light. She can count the bricks on a building 1.5 miles away! Be aware that the eyepieces may be too narrow for some adults, like me. But I think they're perfect for a preteen who needs something a bit smaller than adult-size binoculars.
customer_reviews.author: Renee S.

customer_reviews.title: They were so good, I'm hoping he won't like them and I'll ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a Father's Day gift for my husband, and before wrapping them I had to try them out. They were so good, I'm hoping he won't like them and I'll get to keep them for myself. I was able to see tiny birds clearly, and the compact size and light weight of these binoculars is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Dandelion Farmer

customer_reviews.title: Great little binoculars
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic little binoculars! Lightweight and easy to adjust focus and size to fit your face frame. We used these on a recent trip to the coast and spend time in our hotel room watching the ocean for whales and checking out the goodies in the ocean. My 3 year old loves to use these too to spy on the neighbors and look for birds.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin G.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic viewing
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to take on a cruise this year, because they’re small and lightweight, not really expecting a lot of viewing magnification. But they exceeded my expectations. Really like them, and will now be using them more than my larger, heavier binoculars.
customer_reviews.author: Luv41

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and value - super sharp and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: These are great little binoculars. A super value for less than thirty bucks! I needed them for a sporting event and they delivered 100%. Easy to set up and use. They are small (see photos) but perfectly adequate for stowing away in your jacket pocket during a hike or for your kids graduation. I am very pleased with the quality and value.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Galvin

customer_reviews.title: Great binoculars! They're small
customer_reviews.text: Great binoculars! They're small, but powerful. We used them to view wildlife in Yellowstone and they were super easy to use for both adults and kids. They come with a handy carrying case and are very durable. Overall they work really well and are well made.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: Small compact but fabulous
customer_reviews.text: Needed these to follow my daughter playing in golf tournaments. The clarity is amazing. Very powerful. They have exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: fred sandler

customer_reviews.title: ... section and I must say they gave me an excellent view of the horses and acrobatics
customer_reviews.text: Took these binoculars to see Cavalia Odesseo from the nose bleeders section and I must say they gave me an excellent view of the horses and acrobatics. I could easily see the violin soloist, the Spanish guitarist, and the enchanting vocalist behind the shrouds on the balconies. I will never watch a stage performance the same way again. I find that at a certain distance, I didn’t have to adjust the focus as often as I had expected. The focal sweet spot is pretty large. There is a mild chromatic aberration when viewing in daylight hours against the light, but this goes away when I fine tune the focus. For the price, these binoculars can’t be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Somreth

customer_reviews.title: It's not night vision, not waterproof, Not as described. Disappointed. I can't even return it, just want my money back.
customer_reviews.text: We bought 4 binoculars for our travel to San Diego and this Aruosports one is for my son. Compared to my Bushnell one, can't even see target in dim weather, it's not night vision at all. And there are water drops inside the lens after a night in the wild, also not waterproof as advertised. What's more I can't even return it. I want my money back, please help.
customer_reviews.author: Ashirely

customer_reviews.title: Terrible lenses, don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Went birdwatching in Colombia with 2 pairs of these binoculars, and was a total waste. Thankfully our guide had a spotting scope that worked great, and we were still able to enjoy the trip. With these binoculars everything was way out of focus or completely not visible, despite multiple attempts to focus on distant objects. Very dissatisfied with this product and would recommend everyone to try something else other than this pair, especially if you're relying on these for a vacation or special event.
customer_reviews.author: Jayanth Iyengar

customer_reviews.title: Good Pair of Compact Binoculars
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and compact set of binoculars. Clear views and field of view is decent. Comes with carrying case, lens covers, and neck strap. My only critique of this product is that there were no instructions on how to properly attach the neck straps and it was not intuitive. However, I emailed the company and they promptly provided me with instructions on how to attach the neck straps. I have attached a photo of the instructions in case anyone else needs to reference it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Are we sure these are binoculars.
customer_reviews.text: I have had three friends look through these and they see absolutely no difference. I can not get any magnification at all and feel they must have not put in correct lenses. Only item I have ever gotten that was a flop.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheep Junk.
customer_reviews.text: Cheep Junk. Plastic lenses. Like looking through a dirty window.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Aurosports Binoculars 10 x 25 and expected to see a close up of a Bird or animal = like in the advertisements. When i used it for the first time, I saw a tiny, blurry, moving speck. Yes, the information says that these binoculars are good for about the length of a football field. Tell that to the birds. IN REAL WORLD WORLD USE FOR VIEWING ANIMALS, these binoculars are useless.
customer_reviews.author: Louise, Baltimore, MD

customer_reviews.title: Considering the low price, I'm very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: They seem to be good budget binoculars. They feel good in use, seem well aligned, and focus easily. I don't know why they are claimed to be suited for night, since 10x25 is inherently going to have limited light gathering power, but I think they are claiming that they use high quality coatings that minimize light losses. I compared them to Bausch and Lomb 9x22 binoculars and felt the images were on par with each other. The 10x power makes it hard to hold steady, so consider 8x binoculars if you don't want to deal with that. Considering the low price, I'm very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Telllekstr

customer_reviews.title: A decent pair of cheap binoculars
customer_reviews.text: Being in the military for over 20 years and if something says Night Vision.... Well this product isn't it and should not have "Night Vision" in the products name. No, I was not expecting NVGs with these. What I was expecting is a clear field of view and optics that did not blur or distort in low level/night time and to that measure they are adequate. These bionoculars are good for children or to throw in your hiking bag (if you don't have any already) for occasional use. For star gazing I'd recommend a higher power optic.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis

customer_reviews.title: ADEQUATE
customer_reviews.text: THIS ITEM IS A NICE COMPACT BINOCULAR. DON'T EXPECT STRONG MAGNIFICATION OR THE ABILITY TO SEE ANYTHING WHEN IT GETS TOO DARK. HOWEVER, FOR DAYTIME USE IT IS JUST FINE. IT IS EASY TO FOCUS, BUT DON'T EXPECT CRYSTAL CLEAR IMAGES. OVERALL, I THINK THIS ITEM IS ADEQUATE FOR THE NON-DEMANDING USER WHO CAN APPRECIATE THE COMPACT DESIGN AND EASE OF USE.
customer_reviews.author: Errol B. Sperling

customer_reviews.title: Double vision
customer_reviews.text: I've used high powered binoculars and other types of optics since 2005. I bought these for a trip to the mountains and found I can't get a clear sight picture without double vision unless I use about an inch of eye relief. I expected better, based on the reviews. I'm in the mountains of North Carolina and I'm using these at distances ranging from 25 yards to well over 2000 yards. Something is terribly wrong with these binoculars.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: if your eyes are very far apart you will have a hard time using them because the are pretty small and dont open up very far
customer_reviews.text: I just got these today and plan to using them while on a cruise for whale watching. The description says waterproof, but I dont see that on the box anywhere so I hope they are! Also, if your eyes are very far apart you will have a hard time using them because the are pretty small and dont open up very far. I'll update after I use them on the cruise.
customer_reviews.author: painters wife

customer_reviews.title: weak binoculars
customer_reviews.text: DId not realize that this is maybe the weakest binoculars you can buy, and if you have sight problems, like astigmatism, I suggest you get a monocular.
customer_reviews.author: Do not trust this

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the price, compatible with binoculars costing much more.
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for military grade binoculars, you are in the wrong price range. However, for recreational use these work just fine. They are light weight, small and provide a crisp clear view. For the price they are excellent, and better than some binoculars I've paid much more for. One caveat. These are 10x. That means, as with any binocular over about 7x, they can be a little harder to keep steady. But that is a problem for all but the most expensive binos over 7x power. Over all, a good value and serviceable set for general outdoor activities.
customer_reviews.author: The Fat Man

customer_reviews.title: Money Well Spent
customer_reviews.text: Good pair of binos for utility use. Not as compact as I would like, but good glass, sharp focus, and water/weather resistant. Bought two of these for 9 year old boys, and liked them so much I bought a third to keep in my truck. They are a touch too big for my hunting kit because of the way I outfit, but I have other binos for that. The lads have used them extensively on hiking trips, scouting, and just around the yard, and they have held up very well. These are not Pentax or Zeis binos, but they are definitely a step above the typical Simmons or Bushnell cheapos. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: J&C

customer_reviews.title: Great view enhancement in a small package
customer_reviews.text: These are not the smallest and will not fit in a normal pocket. Know that, and expect to get better performance than the pocket size in what i still consider a relatively compact set of binoculars. I hunt with these fitting fine into my small boy scout pack, and have no problem identifying animals across 100-150 yds. So far no fogging issue during winter hunts. The only downside is the adjusters are not very smooth, and feels jumpy when trying to fine tune.
customer_reviews.author: Josh F

customer_reviews.title: Well, at first I thought these were broken kids ...
customer_reviews.text: Well, at first I thought these were broken kids binoculars and was going to return them because they didn't fit over my nose and was making things appear further than they actually were. Turns out I was using them backwards. After turning them the right way, WOW what deal. Used them at the shooting range for 50 and 100yd targets and they are clear as can be. Comes with a case and a strap to hang them around your neck.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa A.

customer_reviews.title: Works Better for Kids!
customer_reviews.text: While the binocular is quite compact and reasonably priced, it is too small for practical use- at least for me. It was also difficult to focus to get a good, clear image- may be we got a defective piece but we decided to return it since it was too small for our preference. I would, however recommend this for small kids- it is the perfect size for children.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonAddict

customer_reviews.title: Nice Binoculars but awkward to carry on belt, need case neck strap
customer_reviews.text: I like the binoculars but the case has no strap to put around your neck. This is a little large to put on your belt. Add a strap and add a dollar to the price. The pair I had before (which I lost) was smaller and that case had a strap and belt loop. I was considering another brand that did have a case neck strap and failed to verify that these did/did not have one. BTW: the binocular strap does not attach like the one in the photo (looks nicer); it is okay but not same.
customer_reviews.author: Reader123

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I bought these binoculars to watch migrating whales, observe fishing boats on the ocean and some bird watching. These have worked out great! I have used big-sized binoculars before and they're just too heavy for me. The Aurosports binoculars are light enough for me to control. I wear glasses and have used the binoculars with my glasses on and could see very well but when I finished using them I had a smudge on my glasses so I just take my glasses off when I use them without a problem. I have used the binoculars at twilight and have had no difficulty seeing what I wanted to see.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price!
customer_reviews.text: First time owning a binocular and loving it! Have been to Alaska and Yellowstone (reason why I bought it) to spot wildlife and really enjoyed it. Very good quality for the price so really recommend this product. The only thing is that you need to tie a knot on the strings as I almost lost it twice as it became loose very quickly while walking with it hanging on my neck (like in 5 min of use).
customer_reviews.author: Bárbara

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be good quality for the money
customer_reviews.text: I've never owned a GOOD (expensive?) pair of binocs, so have nothing to compare these to. I bought these on a whim and they seem pretty decent. They came with basic instructions on how to focus them. I can see pretty clearly across two neighbor yards. I'm not sure what I'll use them for, but now I know I have a decent set if I ever need them.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Torkko

customer_reviews.title: No night vision as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure where they get the "weak light night vision". It's not mentioned one time on the box, the product, or the instructions. I tried them at dusk and dark, and there is absolutely no benefit to any other binocular. The advertiser just added that and it's a complete sham. Otherwise, decent small binoculars. They aren't very powerful, but they are very small and lightweight. They also seem sturdy, they could probably survive dropping them. If not for the false night vision claims, I would give these 4 or 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin B

customer_reviews.title: Works great, great price!
customer_reviews.text: I used these for the first time at a Michigan football game. I sit in one end of the end zone and had no problem seeing to the other end of the end zone. They are lightweight so exactly what you want when you will be wearing them around your neck for long periods of time. I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah J. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Vision quality is better than my prescription lenses
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical at first. The more I use them, the more I like them. The quality is good, especially at night. I take off my prescription lenses and I think I can see better with the binoculars. For me, it was too difficult to focus with my glasses. The quality is fantastic along with the price. Gave 5 stars due to quality, price, arrival time.
customer_reviews.author: Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Ultra lightweight and sufficient for this bowhunter
customer_reviews.text: I have used bigger and probably higher quality binoculars, but after walking 5 or 6 miles with a backpack full of heavy crap, I had to do something to lighten my load. My knees were killing me! These are perfect! They take up a qtr of the space and cuts what feels like, several pounds from my pack. Easy to focus and decent image and field of view.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Small, Compact, Clear
customer_reviews.text: I ride bikes a lot, go to the beach, and hike. I wanted a small set of binoculars to check out the wildlife. I had some bigger binoculars but they're too heavy and clunky and I usually just left them in my car when I went hiking because they were more trouble than they're worth. These actually fit in one of the larger pockets of my hiking pants, so they don't bounce around. In addition to that, the quality is good, too. I can see birds from 100 yards away, which is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: good for beginners
customer_reviews.text: We took it for whale and bird watching. The distance on this is not great, so I would say it is a beginners tool. This is how I would describe it: it is fine for first-timers, cant get too much detail, you will see a little better than what you see with a naked eye.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: I am happy with my purchase especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: I am new to bird watching, so I purchased these binoculars to help me with my new hobby. I am happy with my purchase especially for the price. It was a good buy. It is compact, light weight and the focus is great !I would definitely recommend this product if you are looking for something economical. It is a little small, but I would choose small as opposed to big and bulky. This is my first pair of binoculars, and i'm sticking with Aurosports!
customer_reviews.author: Lori L. Underwood

customer_reviews.title: Great clarity
customer_reviews.text: I am new to birding and was simply amazed at how clear these make viewing the wildlife. I could see individual feathers on a robin and was able to clearly see the new antlers on a deer which I've been watching for the past month. It was an amazing experience. The attached image was taken from my phone through the binoculars and I was really surprised at how it turned out. For the price, these are really good.
customer_reviews.author: A Homan

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Decent compact binoculars. Different than my other ones in that the eye pieces on this have individual adjustment for vision (both turn). Not needing to adjust them normally, I hope I don’t accidentally turn them. Has the standard focus wheel in the center. Comes with a Velcro closure case. Also, cups/protection for the eye piece that are attached to each other so its one pieces, which is nice. Includes is a little lint rag. Optional strap to attach and hang around neck.
customer_reviews.author: Cutie 3.14

customer_reviews.title: Well made and decent but you get what you pay for. Not the best
customer_reviews.text: I understand the price point for these is low. They are a good lightweight binocular but really feel zooming in with any modern camera phone could give you the same quality of depth you’d be looking for in a binocular. Good for a very local backyard tree or something of the sort, but not true wildlife binoculars or anything fantastic for a sporting event.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Briceba

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the Price and Size!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy ! Compact - just the size I needed. Lightweight - great because I'm already carrying other items and don't need extra bulk. Focus - very quick and easy. I have vision in one eye that is stronger than the other. This totally focuses and adjusts to my need. Distance - I didn't realize it would actually work so well on such a great distance. I'm mostly using for birding. Comes with handy pouch, lense cloth and strap. Nicely boxed.
customer_reviews.author: navymom2014

customer_reviews.title: Hard to adjust at times and slightly better at night
customer_reviews.text: Don't let other review fool you. These are just run of the mill typical binoculars. The size is alright and nice if you want to easily carry them, but they are not better then other slightly more expensive binoculars I've had in the past. If you want to get a better zoom, buy something else. Seem sturdy though! They do capture a little more light at night though.
customer_reviews.author: Leon St. Corsa

customer_reviews.title: Simple, Straight forward, Cost Effective
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent binoculars for the price. I was expecting a poorer quality for the lower price. I was surprised. They work well and are easily adjusted. I can use them without my glasses, and the image is clear and crisp. They have a slight coating on them that reduces the glare which helps. All in all, they are well worth the cost and are great for general wildlife watching or checking out the distant scenery.
customer_reviews.author: Travis E. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: light and have excellent image quality
customer_reviews.text: We bought these compact binoculars for our Tanzania safari last year. They worked perfectly as they are small, light and have excellent image quality. All at a price that makes them almost disposable. I highly recommend these binoculars. BTW we still keep them on our condo balcony for watching birds and manatees in the canal behind our condo. Our neighbor just bought a pair after looking through ours.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not great quality for birding
customer_reviews.text: I got this for birding & it's not the best for this activity. Obviously this is a less expensive product so the quality is poor for looking at things far away & hard to adjust it to focus on objects. This makes it difficult for birding especially since they are moving & small.
customer_reviews.author: Healani

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight pair for all ages
customer_reviews.text: We bought these lightweight binoculars for bird watching. We have an older pair/ different brand from about 25 years ago. This new pair is definitely a great size for everyone in our family from the younger ones to the adults. Crisp view. We are very pleased. We are excited to take them camping this weekend. The strap is a bit cheaply made but we are looking at finding a more rugged strap to take them hiking. The price is low enough for us to not be concerned about paying for a thicker strap.
customer_reviews.author: Chede

customer_reviews.title: Not a very good Binocular
customer_reviews.text: found these not very user friendly. not very clear when viewing subject. focus adjustment was a little sticky. The eye adjustment when fully closed was still a little wide for my eye separation so if you have a small face you may not get a good fit. Also had difficulty focusing the one movable eye piece. These were returned.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky D

customer_reviews.title: Tested Side-by-Side and this one Wins
customer_reviews.text: I tested this against the Occer and despite having a lower stated magnification this pair being cheaper (by about $8 as of my writing), this aurosport has better magnification. It’s also lighter and has a good feel on the adjusters. Bit less no-frills than its competitors but it is honest about its magnification quality, which I appreciate. So if you’re just looking for a casual pair then this is a good value. (Reason I knocked it one star is because it had some smudging (didn’t appear to be fingerprint) on one side of the viewer so hoping to get it replaced. )
customer_reviews.author: Dave Walker

customer_reviews.title: This is an amazing binoculars, super light and compact
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing binoculars, super light and compact .The non-slip Grip makes it very comfortable to hold and view. we have a backyard which is a natural preservation zone with lots of wildlife , the binoculars is an amazing purchase to view the animals from a closer range . we have had other binoculars but this one beats the quality , the clarity is awesome and I am extremely happy with the purchase .
customer_reviews.author: Bhav

customer_reviews.title: Spend more on a better pair
customer_reviews.text: These binoculars are okay. The fact is we now have three inexpensive binoculars and the fact is they are not that good when you get there. Someone else will have a high quality compact binocular (likely nitrogen filled) and they are so much better you will resolve to buy a pair like theirs. So skip this step and just go get a pair that you will love and keep for many years. These are more on the end of the spectrum towards disposable. No one will want to borrow them from you! LOL
customer_reviews.author: peter Rabbit

customer_reviews.title: Aurosports 10x25 Folding High Powered Binoculars With Weak Light Night Vision
customer_reviews.text: I live by a major shipping river and enjoy watching the lake freighters as they pass by. I bought these sweet little binoculars to get a better look as the ships pass. I'm very happy with the quality and the affordable price. They also have a good clear view and they are easy to focus. These will be great for hunting, boating and would make a good gift. I highly recommend these binoculars and will be buying another pair soon to keep in my truck.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Bieth

customer_reviews.title: Best viewing that money can buy
customer_reviews.text: I searched through dozens and dozens of pairs of binoculars in a large national sporting goods store. All of the (expensive) binoculars I tried paled in comparison to these. I have never used a pair of binoculars that performed as well as these. They are crystal clear, easy to adjust , sturdy and lightweight. I like them so much I'm ordering another pair for my husband. I may even give them as gifts at Christmas this year. Excellent product at a fantastic price. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Performs like the expensive ones!
customer_reviews.text: My wife is a bird nerd and has a few high end sets of binoculars. I purchased these so she can keep in it the glovebox of the car. That are compact however they are not tiny. I didn't tell her they were so inexpensive and she loves them. I have even noticed she grabs these sometimes before the expensive ones. She said they are lighter and eaiser to focus than the big ones. I tried them and the optics are really good, excellent for the price. Great value and happy wife!
customer_reviews.author: Mr McFeely

customer_reviews.title: Compact, does it's job
customer_reviews.text: I work in a high rise with a wide view across the city. This binocular does it's job for me to look around. It's fun to peep down to street level as well as into the office buildings next door. The strap took me awhile to figure out how to setup and loop so it holds. It's a little thin and cuts the neck if you let it hang for awhile. The bag that came with the binoculars are a bit on the small side as the flap doesn't really reach the velcro fully to close.
customer_reviews.author: K. Lin

customer_reviews.title: Compact and clear
customer_reviews.text: I needed small binoculars that travels well so I purchased this item based on the positive reviews and price. I tested around my house to see birds. The magnification and clarity is excellent. Width is adjustable and there is a dial focus the image. I'm glad I found these at this price and I'll be picking up a few more for the family trip coming up. Small and lightweight enough to throw in the luggage and bust our whenever.
customer_reviews.author: David K.

customer_reviews.title: These are really good binoculars for the price
customer_reviews.text: These are really good binoculars for the price, they came in a nice box with a lens cloth and a pouch to keep binoculars in. My birds are only about 15-20 feet away so these definitely suffice,if you're looking for something more powerful or for further away then you'll have to splurge on a more expensive pair. I'm quite pleased with these for my backyard bird watching.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Travel
customer_reviews.text: Used these on our recent cruise to Alaska. Surprisingly descent quality and magnification for the price and compact size. I'll definitely take them on future trips as well as camping and hiking. Comes with a neck strap, rear lens cover, case and small microfiber cloth. Only wish was that they'd come with a front lens cover as well.
customer_reviews.author: WoodTurner

customer_reviews.title: great for casual viewing
customer_reviews.text: I actually purchased these for use on an Alaska cruise, but since they came, I've been using them in the back yard as well. And that has been fun. They aren't fine optical instruments, but that's fine with me. If I lose them on a trip, or leave them behind somewhere, I won't be too concerned since they're not too expensive. But they work well for my purpose. They're small, light weight, and still offer fairly good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Atlanta Jack

customer_reviews.title: Excellent clarity and distance viewing!
customer_reviews.text: On a recent family beach vacation, I tried my brother-in-law's Nikon 10x25 binoculars. They were fantastic; absolutely clear and long range. After looking on Amazon I found these, very well reviewed (and less cost too). Based on the reviews, I bought them. Excellent clarity and range; every bit as good as the Nikon. At this price point, they should sell well.
customer_reviews.author: JimInRaleigh

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect little binos! Ideally we will be using them to take to the beach to watch out for the wild and in our back garden. The clarity is great and we are very happy with our purchase. Keep up the great work!
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: NOT A GREAT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: The binoculars are just okay. The strap is so cheap and difficult to attach BUT you get what you pay for. Personally, I wasn't impressed but for the price, they'll work for what I needed. If you wear glasses, look for another pair of binoculars.
customer_reviews.author: Dana L. Booth

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality
customer_reviews.text: Not good quality!! Would not purchase again. Too late to return.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Price!
customer_reviews.text: I purchases the 10x25 model. For comparison, I own a pair of the Nikon Prostaff 8x25 binoculars as well. The Aurosports model does not provide the same clarity as the Nikon, but close enough plus the Nikon is 4-5 times the price. Also, while similar size, the Aurosports is much lighter. They were light enough for my grade school daughter to use, and reasonably priced enough that I didn't worry about her using them. While not the best clarity, for the price, you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Mcshort

customer_reviews.title: Two too many corners cut.
customer_reviews.text: Optics are good for the price. -1 ⭐️ for poorly written instructions. -1 ⭐️ Poor quality lanyard and the way to attach to the optic. Suggestion: 1) Have someone with a better credential than a C+ in a night school ESL class write the instructions. 2) Invest another 12 cents per unit in a half way decent lanyard. The one included with the optic is 1/2 step above a shoe lace.
customer_reviews.author: alfisch

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I gave it away because I couldn't even see across the room with it. It was difficult to try to adjust. If I do another purchase, I will definitely go for something of much higher quality. Maybe a kid would be happy with these, but they wouldn't be able to adjust them either, I don't believe.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect to keep in the car for whale watching!
customer_reviews.text: I live near the ocean and during whale season I like to stop and watch for active whales. These are super compact and great to keep in the glove box in case I just happen to be out and about and didn't bring my larger pair from home.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica J.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly the Same!
customer_reviews.text: We wanted small binoculars for our trip to Europe including a cruise. They worked fine for looking at castles and vineyards from our boat. The binoculars weren't heavy or hard to hold and use. However, I spent a lot of time comparing these to the SGODDE Compact Binoculars 10x25 binoculars. The box was different and one came with a flimsy lens cover, but otherwise they were identical and made in China. So buy which ever one is less money!
customer_reviews.author: Keith Amundson

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: These vernaculars are absolutely great my family and I love going birdwatching but the recent binoculars that we had before we weren’t exactly the best one so I’ve been looking on Amazon for a good pair Panna killers and this was just perfect I’m so glad I found this because the price for this was just amazing I can’t believe it was so cheap considering what a Bina killers are very overpriced so very happy you are happy with that
customer_reviews.author: Shivani

customer_reviews.title: 3 of us tried these and couldn't get a good, clear image (for me
customer_reviews.text: 3 of us tried these and couldn't get a good, clear image (for me, I got double images even after fiddling with all settings and (gasp) reading the instructions). I thought it might have just been me with my 55-year-old vision, but 2 other family members didn't find them particularly good for looking at distant wildlife on our open, 2-acre lot. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Holloway

customer_reviews.title: Easy to acquire subject. Clear sight.
customer_reviews.text: I live in the country. I like to watch the wildlife. I normally use my camera. I wanted something to leave on the table. These are easy to pickup and hold subjects. Lightweight and the case is easy to remove. I have high end Nikon lenses. While the glass isn't as good as a $2000 lens. I have no complaints with the optical quality. If you're looking for perfect optics you'll need to spend money. I'm very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Gene

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight binocs for backpacking/hiking
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for and a great value. Don't have to worry too much about them when out on the trail in variable conditions. Great steady viewing and lighter and brighter than the 12 x 25 Occers that I bought to compare. Couldn't really tell a practical difference in the magnification levels. Will see how they perform over time.
customer_reviews.author: K. Seleen

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive binoculars for hunting
customer_reviews.text: I use these binoculars for hunting. They are good quality and serve my purpose well. Small and compact and fit in my hunting bag well. The case needs to be a little bigger. The picture quality when looking through the lenses is above average but not top notch. But I got exactly what I expected for the price.
customer_reviews.author: PhaQ Left

customer_reviews.title: Clear crisp view
customer_reviews.text: I love these, such a clear view. Sitting on my back deck I can really bring the birds in close. One evening looking across the the way I seen something moving thinking a deer. I grabbed the binoculars and oh my goodness it was not 1 deer but actually 3 bucks and they looked to be at least 12 points. I was so impressed with how clear and close they focused in. Definitely not disappointed with this purchase. I love the small case it fits in with the one piece lens cap and neck strap.
customer_reviews.author: MyBig Dipper

customer_reviews.title: Best in price range.
customer_reviews.text: You could spend 100 bucks and get worse binoculars. I have them for spotting wildlife at the lodge I work at in Alaska. I bought them because they are cheap enough that I won’t be heartbroken if I hand them to a guest and they break them, but so far I’m SUPER impressed by them. They are clear, bright, focus well, and up as north as I am I can use them 24/7 because it doesn’t get much darker than sunset here. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Wilson

customer_reviews.title: For the birds
customer_reviews.text: You sometimes get what you pay for- I planned to use these to watch birds less than 20 feet away. I get a clearer view with my eyes. I would not reccomend these. I did not contact the seller and should have returned the item.
customer_reviews.author: D. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Could not adjust
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the binoculars in October to use for my January honeymoon. Before use, you have to adjust the view to accommodate your vision specs. The right lense would not even turn which made the adjustment impossible. I am outside of my return window, otherwise I would return this product. If you buy, immediately ensure the products works rather than waiting until you plan to actually use them.
customer_reviews.author: bev

customer_reviews.title: -fog +water
customer_reviews.text: They fogged when it was cold, which wasn't good. However in their defense I fell in a lagoon with them around my neck, and it took some time but after they dried out they were back to normal (my kayak buddy's bino's from a different company did not survive". A little heavy but not really enough to care.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Pate

customer_reviews.title: Works great for me
customer_reviews.text: I realized my ancient hand-me-down binos were blurry and not great. Fine for finding my daughter among the kids swimming in the late, but no good for finding a comet among the stars. Blurry. Bought these. No complaints. Good size to store. Sharp. No issues at all. I was able to see the city of Savannah from a beach on Hilton Head Island. Good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent optics, but they didn’t last...
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for the price when new, but they didn’t last. They managed to come out of alignment after a couple months of riding in the seldom-opened uncluttered glove box of my sedan; so now they have double vision. Short term use is fine, but they don’t last. I would expect they would be easily knocked out of alignment in a suitcase or backpack if the easy riding glove box will damage them.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Stanley

customer_reviews.title: Great Set of Binoculars
customer_reviews.text: Great light weight binoculars. The adjustable neck strap make this unit easy to wear for any sporting event. They adjust easy and work great in daytime light. I have not tried using them in low light or at night. I love that they come with lens covers; but honestly though they get the job done, the covers are a bit flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: She likes Orange

customer_reviews.title: Surprised
customer_reviews.text: I've used various binos in my time and I can honestly say that for what I paid for these they can't be beat. I tried 2 other different pairs that I got from Walmart and kmart that were in this price range and they were horrible. These feel good in your hand and focus fairly easy. The strap that comes with it is not ideal but it serves the purpose. If your able to spend hundreds of dollars then I would go with something like Steiners glasses but if ur just looking for something that works and has good quality then I don't think you will be disappointed. This is just my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: P Hamm

customer_reviews.title: good quality for price.  Didn't fit
customer_reviews.text: The binoculars arrived when Amazon said they would. They were the quality I expected. However, I have a wide face . I could not adjust it wide enough. My daughter enjoyed them. I may need another pair/brand.
customer_reviews.author: Abigail's mom

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat them for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I read lots of reviews before selecting these. Bought three pair for a safari (weight was a big consideration.) Construction is excellent. There will always be a tradeoff with binoculars but for this price, I am more than satisfied. Very easy to set up, and they are clear. I don't expect much from the "night vision" but am very pleased with the performance in bright sunlight (which I expect there will be in abundance.)
customer_reviews.author: Jan R. Klincewicz

customer_reviews.title: Great for watching the wild animals!
customer_reviews.text: We live on the golf course and have a lot of deer, right now we are seeing all of the spring fawns, I can look up close just as though I were standing right next to them! Great for bird watching as well.
customer_reviews.author: Live4Life

customer_reviews.title: These are not night vision binoculars.
customer_reviews.text: We really like these. However they should not mention anything about night vision. They do not have night vision. They do slightly enhanced low level light but not enough to remotely mention night vision in the description for this product. It's deceptive and it's inaccurate and frankly I would not have bought them . That being said for the price they are great binoculars they just do not have night vision
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little binocular for the price.
customer_reviews.text: We ordered these binoculars after reading a lot of reviews and recommendations from another Travelers blog. We used these for our trip to Alaska several months ago and we're absolutely Amazed by the clarity and ease of use. I cannot stress enough how important it is to follow the calibration card that comes with the binoculars. This calibration made it a world of difference once done properly. I would highly recommend these to anyone else looking for a budget-friendly binocular.
customer_reviews.author: brian

customer_reviews.title: Great except one thing
customer_reviews.text: Really great binos for some like animal watching outdoors. Like that their are to ways to adjust to get a really sharp view. Only thing is that the lanyard is a slim piece of string and does not seem very durable. Ironically in the demo video the man selling the binos compared their high quality lanyard to their competitors low quality lanyard. Well they have went down to their competitors level.
customer_reviews.author: Nicrostar

customer_reviews.title: Great, Light Weight Binoculars!
customer_reviews.text: These guys are great bang for the buck! Very compact and focus quickly and easily! Much better than the old 2 tube opera style compacts. I’ve got a couple pairs of those I’m tossing and replacing with these! They come with a nice case, strap and cleaning cloth. Can’t go wrong at this price! Think I’ll stuff a few stockings with these next month! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Fergdaddy

customer_reviews.title: Not for us.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed but I guess for the price that’s to be expected. We could never get them focused for distance viewing and they were uncomfortable when viewing through them because we could not get a good setting to see out inspire of numerous attempts to adjust so they are sitting unused in a desk drawer.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Nolan

customer_reviews.title: Binoculars for hiking.
customer_reviews.text: These are great binoculars that do great in low light. They aren't too heavy, so I can comfortably take them on nature walks for quick and clear views of beautiful creatures and my surroundings. They are built strong and have a high quality feeling.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey

customer_reviews.title: They’re just okay...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these compact binoculars for a trip. Unfortunately they are not all that great for wildlife viewing. They might be okay for concerts or sporting events and that is likely what I’ll end up using them for. I do not recommend if you are going to use them for sightseeing. View is not clear.
customer_reviews.author: C. T.

customer_reviews.title: Aurosports 10x25 Folding High Powered Compact Binoculars
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for our vacation to Alaska. They were ok for short distances, but this does not replace the view with my Nikons. For casual use, but if you want to see more from farther away for once in a life time events, these are not the ones to buy. Not sorry I purchased them but, should have taken my bulkier Nikons.
customer_reviews.author: AJ3

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I got this binoculars for my husband for Father's day. I researched on many brands and decided to try this due to the good reviews and that it is compact and lightweight, which is a plus for travelling. I truly am not disappointed because the product came well packaged with adequate instructions on how to use, which was pretty quick. The objects at a far distance were very clear and I like that it has a rubber non slip outside. I would definitely recommend the product to anyone. It is a great buy!!!
customer_reviews.author: sylven

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME !!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very NICE binoculars ! I really wasn’t expecting them to be this nice and have a definite quality feeling to them !! Crystal clear optics and the adjustments are pretty precise ! Durable... compact... and a can’t go wrong decision to buy them choice !!! Nice little case comes with it that COULD be just a tad bigger to fit these beauties into easier... also comes with a nice comfortable neck strap as well ! WELL DONE !!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Darin Pratt

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper and just as good as others
customer_reviews.text: I started looking for binoculars for my dad when he saw the night hero binoculars shown on television. After ordering it, he was highly disappointed in the false marketing attached to the product so I sought out to search for a cheaper and better alternative and stumbled upon these. My dad really loves to use them for large sports events but he says he could see making more use out of them. The main standout for him is the weight and size, says it's small so it's easy for travel, and it's better than any previous one he has. Worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Marvin Williams

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my toddler and his older brother as a Christmas gift. They enjoy pretending to be adventurers. We plan to go to the beach soon as well which they bring these along although they'll have more fun with the binoculars looking for boats and whales. We also plan to take this set with us while camping and hiking. These are sturdy and of great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Traci C

customer_reviews.title: "High Powered Compact Binoculars for Adults Kids "
customer_reviews.text: The eyepieces are really close together. I gave mine to a friends kid because I couldnt use them the way I was expecting to. The label for this was awkward and now I know why. These are probably really good kids binoculars that an adult COULD use if their eyes were close together, but not normal sized binoculars.
customer_reviews.author: TAKULBAKS.DEB

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: These fell apart within days. Some internal parts seem to have come loose, and they could not be focussed anymore. I returned them and ordered another pair, but the same thing happened.
customer_reviews.author: Trekker

customer_reviews.title: Good value for money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift to my wife. It felt so good quality product when we unpacked it. According to my wife it is light weight and compact so she can put it in her jacket pocket. She also found it easy to set-up in the beginning and said once you setup then you only need to adjust one dial which is good. So overall I think it is good value for money. A better quality hanging strap would be good to make it easier to hang around your neck. Overall great value for money. Ramanan Arampamoorthy
customer_reviews.author: Ramanan

customer_reviews.title: For the price these are awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought these for my little 4 year old. I wanted him to have something nicer than a toy. I am debating being a good father and letting him keep them or stealing them and keeping them for myself. They're really amazing for such an inexpensive little product. Looking forward to more products from these guys.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Sellars

product_meta.title: Aurosports 10x25 Folding High Powered Compact Binoculars for Adults Kids With Weak Light Night Vision Clear Binocular for Bird Watching Great for Outdoor Sports Games and Concerts
product_meta.description: Aurosports 10*25 folding high powered binocular is lightweight, pocket size binoculars you can take anywhere. Easy focusing suitable for fishing, golf, bird watching, camping, scope, hiking, concerts specifications: Magnification: 10x objective lens diameter: 25mm eye cups type: twist-up focus system: Center field of view: 362ft/1000 yds. field angle: 6. 9 degrees close Focus: 3M eye relief: 14. 8mm lens coating: Fully Multi-Coated waterproof: Yes tripod adaptable: no Package includes: 1 x binoculars 1 x portable bag 1 x Cleaning Cloth
feature_bullets: Perfect compact lightweight binoculars for bird watching. Can be Used for both day and night (low-light-level night vision, can't see anything in complete darkness)
Large field of view. Focusing in on your target for brilliant detail at 1000 yards out.
Fully multi-coated lenses, waterproof, hyper-durable anti-slip grip gives you everything you want. Light-weight and can be folded, very convenient and easy to carry
10x magnification with 25 mm objective lens allows you to see objects 10x’s closer with clarity that strikes envy into the heart of your bird watching friends
Suitable for both adults and kids, fit for hunting, hiking, exploring, viewing, sailing, bird watching, concert, outdoor sports etc.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars3,352 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
